poem:
The Art of No

In a world of yes men,  
the word "no" tumbles out  
like a rare coin,  
rolling across conversations.  
Defying all its echoes,  
springing off the sidewalk,  
to land—a final clink—  
in the dusty corner of resolve,  
where it gleams quietly,  
a simple shield  
holding back the tide.
